contextId.information: This means that God never sins and is not evil in any way. Cultures that associate evil with darkness may be able to keep the idea of darkness without explaining the metaphor.  AT: "in him there is no darkness of sin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: in him there is no darkness at all

contextId.information: This means "practice goodness" or "do what is good."  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: walk in the light

contextId.information: The truth is spoken of as if it were an object that could be inside believers. AT: "we do not believe what is true" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the truth is not in us

contextId.information: Obeying and honoring God's word is spoken of as if his word were inside the believers. AT: "we do not understand God's word nor obey what he says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: his word is not in us

contextId.information: John was an elderly man and their leader. He used this expression to show his love for them. AT: "My dear children in Christ" or "You who are as dear to me as my own children" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Children

contextId.information: The truth is spoken of as if it were an object that could be inside the believers. AT: "he does not believe what God says is true" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the truth is not in him

contextId.information: Conducting one's life is spoken of as if it were walking. AT: "must live as Jesus Christ lived" or "should also obey God just as Jesus Christ did" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: should himself also walk just as Jesus Christ walked

contextId.information: Here "darkness" refers to evil and "light" refers to goodness. AT: "because you are ceasing to do evil and you are doing more and more good" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the darkness is passing away, and the true light is already shining

contextId.information: This is a picture of living right. When people do what is right, they can do it in the light and not hide in the dark. AT: "he does what is right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: he is in the light

contextId.information: "nothing will cause him to stumble." The word "stumbling" is a metaphor that means to fail spiritually or morally. AT: "nothing will cause him to sin" or "he will not fail to do what is pleasing to God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: there is no occasion for stumbling in him

contextId.information: This is a picture of the believer who is not living as a Christian should be living. AT: "he does not even know he is doing what is evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: he does not know where he is going

contextId.information: John was an elderly man and their leader. He used this expression to show his love for them. AT: "my dear children in Christ" or "you who are as dear to me as my own children." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:1jn:02:01|2:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: dear children

contextId.information: This possibly refers to those who are no longer new believers but are growing in spiritual maturity. AT: "young believers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: young men

contextId.information: The writer refers to the believers' increased faithfulness to Christ and knowledge of him as if he were speaking of God's word existing in them. AT: "you know the word of God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the word of God remains in you

contextId.information: A person cannot love this world and all that dishonors God and love the Father at the same time. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: If anyone loves the world, the love of the Father is not in him

contextId.information: Persuading someone to disobey God is spoken of as if it were leading someone off the right path to follow. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: lead you astray

contextId.information: John was an elderly man and their leader. He used this expression to show his love for them. AT: "my dear children in Christ" or "you who are as dear to me as my own children." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:1jn:02:01|2:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: dear children

contextId.information: John was an elderly man and their leader. He used this expression to show his love for them. AT: "My dear children in Christ" or "You who are as dear to me as my own children." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:1jn:02:01|2:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Dear children

contextId.information: This speaks of the Holy Spirit, whom God gives to believers and who makes them able to resist sin and do what pleases God as if he were a physical seed that is planted in the earth and grows. This is sometimes referred to as the new nature. AT: "the Holy Spirit" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: God's seed

contextId.information: John speaks of a person who hates another believer as if he were a murderer. Since people commit murder because they hate other people, God considers anyone who hates to be as guilty as someone who kills a person. AT: "Whoever hates another believer is as guilty as someone who kills a person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Anyone who hates his brother is a murderer

contextId.information: "shuts up his heart of compassion" is a metaphor. AT: "but does not show him compassion" or "but does not willingly help him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: and shuts up his heart of compassion from him

contextId.information: John was an elderly man and their leader. He used this expression to show his love for them. AT: "My dear children in Christ" or "You who are as dear to me as my own children." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:1jn:02:01|2:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: My dear children

contextId.information: God knows more than a person and judges better. The effect of this truth is probably that God is more merciful than our consciences would suppose. This quality of God is expressed by the term "greater." AT: "God knows more than we do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: God is greater than our hearts

contextId.information: God's opinion is spoken of as if it depends on what he sees happen in front of himself. AT: "and we do what pleases him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: and do the things that are pleasing before him

contextId.information: The close union of believers is expressed by the terms "remains in him." See how "remains in God" was translated in [[:en:bible:notes:1jn:02:04|2:5-6]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: remains in him, and God remains in him

contextId.information: "has taken on human form" or "has come in a physical body" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: has come in the flesh

contextId.information: John was an elderly man and their leader. He used this expression to show his love for them. AT: "my dear children in Christ" or "you who are as dear to me as my own children." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:1jn:02:01|2:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: dear children

contextId.information: The term "the world" refers to all the people who do not obey God and to the system of evil that exists in the sinful world.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the world

contextId.information: This is a metaphor which means someone has a relationship to God like a child to his father. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: born from God

contextId.information: This is a metaphor which means "the character of God is love" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: God is love

contextId.information: This is a metaphor which means "the character of God is love." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:1jn:04:07|4:8]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: God is love

contextId.information: Being in a close relationship to the Son is spoken of as having the Son. AT: "He who believes in the Son of God has eternal life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: The one who has the Son has life
